metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0475 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, and JRockit components in Oracle Java SE 8u66; Java SE Embedded 8u65; and JRockit R28.3.8 allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality and integrity via unknown vectors related to Libraries.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-jamvm - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u72-b15-1
openjdk-8-source - 8u72-b15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8u72-b15-1').
